intro: Ilex atabapoensis, commonly known as the Atabapo holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries that are typically toxic to humans. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Its botanical features include spiny leaves and a compact growth habit, making it well adapted to its ecological niche. Ilex atabapoensis is of interest to botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance.
